2001.Event: Hepatitis B Outbreak in Northern Territory
2001.Description: An outbreak of hepatitis B was reported among Indigenous communities in the Northern Territory. Increased efforts in vaccination and public health education were implemented to control the spread.

2004.Event: Hepatitis A Outbreak Linked to Contaminated Food
2004.Description: A significant outbreak of hepatitis A occurred in New South Wales and Victoria, traced back to contaminated frozen berries. Public health advisories and recalls were issued to prevent further cases.

2008.Description: Queensland experienced a hepatitis A outbreak associated with contaminated semi-dried tomatoes. Enhanced food safety regulations and public awareness campaigns were launched in response.

2011.Event: Hepatitis B Outbreak in Remote Indigenous Communities
2011.Description: A hepatitis B outbreak was identified in remote Indigenous communities in Western Australia. Expanded vaccination programs and targeted public health interventions were initiated.

2014.Event: Hepatitis E Outbreak Linked to Imported Foods
2014.Description: An outbreak of hepatitis E was reported in several states, linked to imported pork products. Public health measures were taken to raise awareness and improve food safety standards.

2017.Event: Hepatitis A Outbreak Among Men Who Have Sex with Men (MSM)
2017.Description: An increase in hepatitis A cases was observed among MSM populations in New South Wales. Vaccination campaigns and educational initiatives were conducted to address the outbreak.

2020.Event: Hepatitis A Outbreak During COVID-19 Pandemic
2020.Description: Despite the COVID-19 pandemic, a hepatitis A outbreak occurred in Victoria, linked to imported fresh produce. Coordinated efforts ensured that routine vaccinations and public health responses continued.
